loans.descr: View your Federal Loan Details.
View your Perkins Loan Details.
View your Institutional, State, and/or HPSL Loan Details.
It is advised that you consult your private loan lender for full details. Private loans may have unknown fees and policies that could impact your overall debt.

estimatedPaymentDisclaimer.title: Estimated Payment Disclaimer
estimatedPaymentDisclaimer.description: The estimates provided on this page are general in nature and not meant as a guarantee or promise of the actual projected amounts. They are based on loan amounts that the institution is aware of and may not include all student debt incurred. Borrowers with private loans may have substantially higher payments.  Interest rates used are estimates and may not reflect your actual interest rate. Federal student loan borrowers may be eligible for repayment plans that extend beyond the standard ten year repayment plan.

links.title: Bears for Financial Success
links.descr: Sit down with a financial wellness peer educator to help you understand your personal finances. Peer mentors can answer basic money management questions and help you create a personal spending plan. This service is for current students only.
links.hover: Meet with a financial wellness peer educator

links.title: Cal Student Central
links.descr: Contact with any questions regarding your loans.

links.title: Federal Loan Detail
links.descr: Log in to National Student Loan Data Systems (NSLDS) to view your detailed federal loan history.
links.hover: NSLDS website to view your Federal loan details

links.title: Federal Loan Summary
links.descr: Log in to studentaid.ed.gov to view a summary of your federal loan history.

links.title: Institutional, State, Perkins and HPSL Loan Detail
links.descr: Visit your loan servicer Heartland ESCI to access your Perkins, HPSL, state and/or institutional loan account(s).
links.hover: State and Institutional Loan Servicer - Heartland ESCI

links.title: Loan Documentation
links.descr: Log in to studentloans.gov to complete or view your Federal Direct Master Promissory Note, Entrance, or Exit Counseling.

links.title: Loan Repayment Estimator
links.descr: You can include Institutional, HPSL, State and/or Private loans by clicking the Add Loan(s) link and selecting Private, then enter the loan amount and interest rate for each additional loan.
links.hover: A tool to estimate your loan repayment

glossary.definition: The Amount Owed includes outstanding principal balances for all loans borrowed while attending Berkeley and/or other schools. The Amount Owed does not include your accruing interest unless it has been capitalized (added to the principal of your loan). Capitalization usually happens when you enter repayment. To review your accrued interest balance, log in to National Student Loan Data Systems.
The Borrowed amount is the sum of all loans borrowed while attending Berkeley. It does not reflect any payments made or accrued interest.

The Calculated Cumulative Debt is the sum of the Amount Owed for Federal Direct and/or Federal Perkins Loans and the Borrowed amount for State,Institutional, and/or Private loans. Note that any payments made toward a State, Institutional, or Private loan are not reflected here.

Subsidized Loans
Interest on subsidized loans accrues from the date of disbursement and continues throughout the life of the loan. While you are in school or in an eligible deferment period, the interest is paid for you by the federal government.

Unsubsidized Loans or Grad PLUS Loans
Interest from unsubsidized or Grad PLUS loans accrue from the date of disbursement and continues to accrue until the loan is paid in full. You can make interest payments while in school to minimize your overall loan costs, but you are not required to do so. If you do not pay your accrued interest while in school, it will be capitalized (added to the principal of your loan). Then you will pay interest on both your original loan amount and the accrued interest that was capitalized.
